channel.title: Using a rotary switch to flip through waveforms
channel.description: I bought a nifty little rotary switch and hooked it up to the digital pins of my axoloti and managed to get some results (I can light up these logic objects by twisting the knob left and right just fine.) I would like to be able to flip through the waveforms included in this object No idea how to do it though. I thought this would work but no luck... Anyone out there know how to do this?

item.title: Using a rotary switch to flip through waveforms
item.dc:creator: @Androoclops
item.description:
@Androoclops wrote:

Crap, i completely forget lol (this was a while ago)
Im making some new boards to mount pots and switches on in eagle though and am planning on adding this to it so Ill have to get it to work eventually lol I will post it when i figured it out!

Read full topic

item.source: Using a rotary switch to flip through waveforms

item.title: Using a rotary switch to flip through waveforms
item.dc:creator: @mtyas Matthew Tyas
item.description:
@mtyas wrote:

Ah, I've been through the same problem, I remember making a very complicated sub-patch to resolve the problem, but then I found a few objects that do the same job. Tonight the only one I seem to find in the community library, is the tiar/logic/BCDEncoder (but I'm sure there are others). It transforms 1 to 8 binary inputs to a integer (from 0 to 7) that you can then feed into your wave selector.

Read full topic
